sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": " 

Consider the adjoining figure. It is given that QO is parallel to PR , and OQ = 5 cm, OS = 2 cm, SP = 5 cm, and SR = 7 cm. Now, calculate QS and PR .
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline
[Figure not drawn to scale] \\
 ", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{In the triangle $OQS$ and triangle $PRS$ we have}$$
\[
	\angle O = \angle P 
\]
\[
	\angle OSQ = \angle PSR 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": " 
$$\text{So, by using angle angle similarity we can write $\Delta OQS \sim \Delta PRS $
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{QS }{SR } = \frac{OS }{SP } = \frac{OQ }{PR } 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{QS }{7 } = \frac{2 }{5 } = \frac{5 }{PR }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow QS = \frac{2 }{5 } \times 7 = 2.8 cm
\]

And
\[
	\Rightarrow PR = \frac{5 }{2 } \times 5 = 12.5 cm
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Since, QO is parallel to PR, therefore, by alternate interor angle property, we have \angle O = \angle P, also, since vertically opposite angles are equal, therefore, \angle OSQ = \angle PSR.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Sice, the ratio of corresponding sides in similar triangle is proportional, therefore, \frac{QS }{SR } = \frac{OS }{SP } = \frac{OQ }{PR }}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Putting the values in the previous equation we get $\frac{QS }{7 } = \frac{2 }{5 } = \frac{5 }{PR }$, which upon simplification gives us $QS = \frac{2 }{5 } \times 7 = 2.8 cm$ and $PR = \frac{5 }{2 } \times 5 = 12.5 cm$ "}]
